messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] help!
messages.msgSnippet: ... I need someone to write my paper for me. Can you tell me everything about my subject? No, but we can help point you in the direction you need to go for
messages.messageBody:
--- Joel Easton <klutzyjackass@...> wrote:

> I need some help on an essay, what were all the
> major Samurai Battles
> and when were there samurai?
> --
> I am the bringer of Pain!

"I need someone to write my paper for me. Can you tell
me everything about my subject?"

No, but we can help point you in the direction you
need to go for your research. Start here:

www.samurai-archives.com

There's an extensive section on battles that you'll
want to look at, plus the links and the suggested
reading will provide you with more than enough
sources.

If you want assistance with a particular question,
we'd be more than happy to do that. You have to be
more specific than "What were all the major samurai
battles?"

__________________________________________________
Do You Yahoo!?

http://mail.yahoo.com

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] help!
messages.msgSnippet: Hi There Another good book readily available is Everyday Life in Traditional Japan : Charles J. Dunn (Tuttle Books)- my 1980 copy was $4.95. It has a large
messages.messageBody:
Hi There

Another good book readily available is ""Everyday Life in Traditional Japan": Charles J. Dunn (Tuttle Books)- my 1980 copy was $4.95. It has a large chapter coving daily lives of the Samurai.

Good Luck

Rod Johnson

kokomans_2,
asked:
hey everybody! I'm currently working on a project for ancient history
class and I need to find information on the daily life of a samurai.
I'm basically done the project except for this part, also I'd like to
know the training that one would go through to become a samurai. If
anybody can help by telling me anyhting they know, or by posting a
link I'll be forever grateful, thanks ahead of time.



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] help!
messages.msgSnippet: kokomans_2, Despite the time period of the class not coinciding with Feudal Japan I can offer one good book on the daily life of the Samurai, as well as
messages.messageBody:
kokomans_2,

Despite the time period of the class not coinciding with "Feudal Japan" I
can offer one good book on the daily life of the Samurai, as well as
everyone else in Japan at that time. The book is called "Everyday Things in
Premodern Japan: The Hidden Legacy of Material Culture" and it is by Susan
B. Hanley ISBN: 0520218124

As for the "training," a very brief overview (academically speaking) can
be found in the book "Secrets of the Samurai: A survey of the Martial Arts
of Feudal Japan" by Ratti and Westbrook ISBN: 0785810730

I hope that this helped you in some way. If I can assist you further
please let me know.



Peace,

Matt

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] help!
messages.msgSnippet: ... Well, for starters, I gotta tell ya... If it s an *ancient* history class you shouldn t be doing anything on samurai, who didn t really come into their own
messages.messageBody:
kokomans_2 wrote:

> hey everybody! I'm currently working on a project for ancient history
> class and I need to find information on the daily life of a samurai.
> I'm basically done the project except for this part, also I'd like to
> know the training that one would go through to become a samurai. If
> anybody can help by telling me anyhting they know, or by posting a
> link I'll be forever grateful, thanks ahead of time.
>

Well, for starters, I gotta tell ya...

If it's an *ancient* history class you shouldn't be doing anything on samurai,
who didn't really come into their own until the 11th century or so.

Tony
